verses.verse: Moreover, brethren, I don't want you to be ignorant how that all of our fathers were under the cloud and all passed through the sea.
All were baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea.
All ate the same spiritual food.
All drank the same spiritual drink, for they drank from that spiritual Rock that followed them and that Rock was Christ.
But with many of them God was not pleased, for they were strewn about the wilderness.
Now these became our examples, for the purpose that we should not lust after evil things, as they lusted.
Neither be idolaters, as some of them were; as it is written, "The people sat down to eat and drink and got up to play sinfully.
Neither let us commit fornication as some of them did and twenty-three thousand fell in one day.
Neither let us see how far we can push Christ as some of them also did and were destroyed by snakes.
Nor whine as some of them did and were destroyed by the destroyer.
Now all these things happened to them for an example, and they are written for a warning to us to whom the ends of the age have come.
Therefore the one who thinks he stands, take heed lest he fall.

No temptation has taken you but what is common to man, but God is faithful who will not allow you to be tempted above what you are able, and with the temptation he will also make a way to escape, so that you can endure it.
Therefore, my dearly beloved, flee from idolatry.
I speak as to those who are wise; judge what I say.
The cup of blessing which we bless, isn't it fellowship in the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, isn't it fellowship in the body of Christ?
For we who are many are one bread, one body, for we are all partakers of that one bread.
Look at Israel--after the flesh--aren't those who eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar [sacrifices]?
So what am I saying that the idol is something or that which is offered to idols is something?
Just the opposite, that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to devils, not to God. And I don't want you to have fellowship with devils.
You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of devils; you cannot be sharers in the Lord's Table and the table of devils.
Are we trying to provoke the Lord to jealousy, or are we stronger than he is?
All things are lawful for me, but not all things are beneficial; all things are lawful for me, but all things do not build up.
No one should be looking out for themselves but for others.
Whatever is sold in the meat market eat without asking questions for sake of conscience.
For the earth is the Lord's and the abundance of it.
If any of those who do not believe invite you [to a feast], and you want to go, eat whatever is set before you. Eat without asking questions for sake of conscience.
But if any one says to you, "This has been offered to idols." Don't eat for the sake of him who told you and for conscience sake, for the earth is the Lord's and the abundance of it.
I say conscience, not of your own but of the other, for why is my freedom judged by another's conscience.
For if I by am a partaker, why am I harshly criticized for what I give thanks?
Therefore whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do everything for the glory of God.
Don't offend anyone, neither Jews nor Gentiles nor the congregation of God.
Even as I try to please all in every way not seeking my own selfish good but for the good of many that they may be saved.
